title: Add stress vs. distress content to an existing learning module with reflection prompt

requirements.text: Add new stress-related learning content (stress vs. distress / eustress vs. distress) as additional content inside an existing learning module in `frontend/src/content/modules.ts` (do not create a new module).

quotes: Add as content without n an existing module

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/modules.ts` is updated to extend (not add) at least one existing `Module` entry by adding new `content` items focused on stress vs. distress.
No new `Module` object is added to `MODULES`; changes are limited to adding content to an existing module.
All added user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Include both (a) short attributed insights/quotes and (b) general summaries inspired by public high-performance figures, covering: Wim Hof, David Goggins, Shawn Ryan, Joe Rogan, Tom Brady, Michael Jordan, Mike Tyson, and Jocko Willink. Do not include copyrighted or unverifiable verbatim quotes; use paraphrased, attribution-style statements (e.g., “Inspired by …”).
acceptanceCriteria: The updated module content includes items that reference each specified figure by name with paraphrased/attribution-style insights (no long verbatim quotes).
The content also includes general explanatory sections defining and contrasting stress vs. distress (including practical framing and examples).
No backend changes are required to render the new content; the Modules page continues to render from `MODULES` without runtime errors.

requirements.text: Add at least one new reflection prompt to the same existing module so users can start a guided journal entry from the module, with `prefillTitle` and `prefillContent` specifically tailored to applying stress-vs-distress concepts and influencer-inspired practices.
acceptanceCriteria: The chosen existing module’s `prompts` array includes at least one new prompt related to stress vs. distress.
Clicking “Start” on the new prompt in `frontend/src/pages/Modules.tsx` navigates to `/journal` with `prefillTitle` and `prefillContent` populated (via the existing search params behavior).
The prefill template includes structured questions/checklist items that help the user identify stressors, distinguish eustress vs. distress, and choose an action + recovery plan.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Do not add a new learning module entry; only add content/prompts to an existing module in `frontend/src/content/modules.ts`.
Do not include copyrighted text verbatim from public figures; use paraphrased/attribution-style summaries instead.
nonGoals: No changes to backend canister logic or storage models.
No new onboarding flow changes beyond the existing modules/journaling integration.
No changes to authentication, invite system, squads, reporting, or admin moderation.
